Romania.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a country in southeast Europe, east of Hungary and west of the Black Sea. Population: 21,790,479 (2014). Capital: Bucharest. From the end of World War II it was a Communist country, but in 1989 there was a revolution. Nicolae Ceau√ßescu, who had led the country since the 1960s, was killed and Romania became a democracy. Romania joined the EU (European Union) in 2007.
